title: Easy Nigerian Party-Style Jollof Rice | Accolade Winning Recipe
p1: Jollof Rice is so good it survived the brutality of the Trans African Ocean Trade in Africans to become popular in the Caribbean. Being from Grenada, I've been eating it since I was a child. It is a testament to the fact that while others perished, we not only survived but refused to relinguish our culture.
p2: Jollof Rice is typically made with long-grain rice, tomatoes, onions, spices, vegetables and meat in a single pot, although its ingredients and preparation methods vary across different regions.
p3: Jollof originates from the Senegambian region that was ruled by the Wolof or Jolof Empire in the 14th century, spanning parts of today's Senegal, The Gambia and Mauritania, where rice is grown. The dish has its roots in a traditional dish called thieboudienne, containing rice, fish, shellfish and vegetables.
p4: Each West African country has at least one variant form of the dish, with Ghana, Nigeria, Sierra Leone, Liberia and Cameroon particularly competitive as to which country makes the best jollof. This is especially prominent between Nigeria and Ghana, in a rivalry dubbed the 'Jollof Wars'.

content.h2: What are the benefits of eating Jollof Rice?

paragraphs.p: Imagine if the 50 million black people in the United States largely ate jollof and other African foods. This would lead to better health outcomes, industrial revolutions on the continent, and a strong black economic bloc. This is what eating jollof is about: our economic interest. And -

li2.h2: Can pregnant women eat Jollof Rice?

paragraphs.p: Absolutely! Babies would be delighted by the plethora of nutrients that this African superfood delivers. Be sure to consume it in moderation, however. Please consult your physician if you have any concerns.

li4.h2: How to cook Nigerian Jollof Rice?

instructions.li1: Soak your beans in a covered container or pot of water for 8 hours
instructions.li3: Cook beans until its just starting to become tender
instructions.li4: Heat up a pot with Palm Oil
instructions.li5: Place your onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and parprika into the oil
instructions.li6: Once the above ingredients begin to give off their aromas, put in the chicken, maggi cubes, smoked shrimp, stock water, chicken, and Afican Black Beans into the pot
instructions.li7: Throw in a whole scotch bonnet pepper and salt to taste

Allow the soup to sit in the pot before serving so as to let the flavors concentrate more.

li8.h2: Where can you find Nigerian Jollof Rice?

paragraphs.p: You can conviently find Egusi seeds and the other African ingredients to make this delicious recipe right here on Boxeon. We currently ship everywhere in the United States, flat rate.

li9.h2: What goes with Nigerian Jollof Rice?

paragraphs.p: I serve Egusi soup with gari, fufu, or pounded yam. Personally, I like a slice or two of Agege bread with my Egusi soup.

Egusi soup is one of the most searched for African dish on Google. A considerable amount of these searches comes from the United States. These searches are coming from African Americans and white Americans. This shows that Egusi soup is as amassing wide appeal. If you're a restaurant owner, place it on your menu and thank me later.
